PKT_FIELD_5_CONFIG

  • Group: 0x12
  • Index: 0x1f
  • Summary: General data processing and packet configuration bits for Field 5.
  • Purpose:
    • Partitioning of the Payload into separate fields is provided to support features such as variable length packets and field-specific data processing (e.g., Manchester encoding, data whitening, etc). This property provides configuration bits for field-specific processing on Field 5.
    • The configuration bits in this property are common to both TX and RX modes dependent on PKT_CONFIG1:PH_FIELD_SPLIT; however, this property is only applicable when automatic Packet Handling is enabled (e.g., when using the TX FIFO as the modulation source in TX mode, or when PKT_CONFIG1:PH_RX_DISABLE is cleared in RX mode).
  • Default: 0x00
  • Register View:
    • PKT_FIELD_5_CONFIG
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x1f 0 0 0 4FSK 0 0 WHITEN MANCH
    Default
    0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    PKT_FIELD_5_CONFIG
    4FSK
    Description:
    • The chip supports field-specific configuration of (G)FSK modulation modes, i.e., 2(G)FSK across certain fields and 4(G)FSK across other fields. In such a case, the Modem must be configured for 4(G)FSK operation across the entire packet (by setting the MODEM_MOD_TYPE property), and the Packet Handler is then configured on a field-by-field basis to process the data stream from the FIFO as bit pairs (for 4(G)FSK) or single bits (for 2(G)FSK).
    • When 4(G)FSK is enabled across a field, the PH pulls two bits from the FIFO and sends them to the TX Modulator to be transmitted as one-of-four deviation levels.
    • When 4(G)FSK is disabled across a field, the PH pulls one bit from the FIFO and replaces it with the appropriate two bits that map to the outer two deviation levels. Although the TX Modulator remains configured for four levels of deviation (by the MODEM_MOD_TYPE property), using only the outer two deviation levels effectively results in 2(G)FSK modulation across that field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable 4(G)FSK data processing on this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable 4(G)FSK data processing on this field.
    WHITEN
    Description:
    • The data whitening/de-whitening function is only available when automatic Packet Handling is enabled (e.g., when using the TX FIFO as the modulation source in TX mode, or when the PH_RX_DISABLE bit in the PKT_CONFIG1 property is cleared in RX mode).
    • In RX mode, the data de-whitening function is performed only on bits stored in the RX FIFO; received data bits observed in real-time (on a GPIO pin) are output prior to de-whitening.
    • Enabling data whitening does not affect the over-the-air data rate.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable data whitening/de-whitening on this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable data whitening/de-whitening on this field.
    MANCH
    Description:
    • Manchester encoding operates by replacing each bit with a two-chip pattern (e.g., each '0' bit with a '10' pattern and each '1' bit with a '01' bit pattern, or vice versa). The desired encoding polarity is selected by PKT_CONFIG1:MANCH_POL.
    • Enabling Manchester encoding in one or more fields does not affect the over-the-air data rate; each bit/chip within the entire packet is transmitted at the same data rate (specified by the MODEM_DATA_RATE_X properties). Manchester encoding simply affects the number of bits/chips that are sent (e.g., by replacing one bit with two chips).
    • In RX mode, the Manchester decoding function is performed only on bits stored in the RX FIFO; received data bits observed in real-time (on a GPIO pin) are output prior to decoding.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable manchester encoding/decoding on this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable manchester encoding/decoding on this field.

PKT_FIELD_5_CRC_CONFIG

  • Group: 0x12
  • Index: 0x20
  • Summary: Configuration of CRC control bits across Field 5.
  • Purpose:
    • This property is use to control the calculation, transmission, and checking of CRC across Field 5.
  • Default: 0x00
  • Register View:
    • PKT_FIELD_5_CRC_CONFIG
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x20 0 0 SEND_CRC SEND_ALT_CRC CHECK_CRC CHECK_ALT_CRC CRC_ENABLE ALT_CRC_ENABLE
    Default
    0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    PKT_FIELD_5_CRC_CONFIG
    SEND_CRC
    Description:
    This bit is applicable only in TX mode, and determines whether the accumulated CRC checksum will be transmitted at the end of this field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Do not Transmit CRC at the end of this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Transmit CRC at the end of this field.
    SEND_ALT_CRC
    Description:
    This bit is applicable only in TX mode, and determines whether the accumulated ALT CRC checksum will be transmitted at the end of this field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Do not Transmit ALT CRC at the end of this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Transmit ALT CRC at the end of this field.
    CHECK_CRC
    Description:
    • This bit is applicable only in RX mode, and determines whether the accumulated CRC checksum will be checked at the end of this field.
    • If the PKT_CONFIG1:PH_FIELD_SPLIT bit is set, this bit is ignored and the CHECK_CRC functionality is obtained from the appropriate PKT_RX_FIELD_X_CRC_CONFIG property.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Do not check CRC at the end of this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Check CRC at the end of this field.
    CHECK_ALT_CRC
    Description:
    • This bit is applicable only in RX mode, and determines whether the accumulated ALT CRC checksum will be checked at the end of this field.
    • If the PKT_CONFIG1:PH_FIELD_SPLIT bit is set, this bit is ignored and the CHECK_ALT_CRC functionality is obtained from the appropriate PKT_RX_FIELD_X_CRC_CONFIG property.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Do not check ALT CRC at the end of this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Check ALT CRC at the end of this field.
    CRC_ENABLE
    Description:
    • This bit is applicable in both TX and RX modes, and enables CRC checksum calculation over this field. Note: enabling CRC calculation across a field does not automatically result in transmission/checking of the CRC checksum at the end of the field.
    • If in RX mode and PKT_CONFIG1:PH_FIELD_SPLIT is set, this bit is ignored and the CRC_ENABLE functionality is obtained from the appropriate PKT_RX_FIELD_X_CRC_CONFIG property.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable CRC calculation over this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable CRC calculation over this field.
    ALT_CRC_ENABLE
    Description:
    • This bit is applicable in both TX and RX modes, and enables ALT CRC checksum calculation over this field. Note: enabling ALT CRC calculation across a field does not automatically result in transmission/checking of the ALT CRC checksum at the end of the field.
    • If in RX mode and PKT_CONFIG1:PH_FIELD_SPLIT is set, this bit is ignored and the ALT_CRC_ENABLE functionality is obtained from the appropriate PKT_RX_FIELD_X_CRC_CONFIG property.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable ALT CRC calculation over this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable ALT CRC calculation over this field.

PKT_RX_FIELD_1_LENGTH

  • Group: 0x12
  • Indexes: 0x21 ... 0x22
  • Summary: Unsigned 13-bit RX Field 1 length value.
  • Purpose:
    • The PKT_RX_FIELD_1_LENGTH properties specify the length of Field 1 in bytes. The field length is an unsigned 13-bit value.
    • Partitioning of the Payload into separate fields is provided to support variable length packets, and to allow different forms of data processing (e.g., Manchester encoding, data whitening, etc) across different fields.
    • These properties are applicable in RX mode only under the following conditions: a) RX Packet Handling is enabled by clearing the PH_RX_DISABLE bit in the PKT_CONFIG1 property, and b) The START_RX command is sent with the parameter RX_LEN=0, and c) PKT_CONFIG1:PH_FIELD_SPLIT is set. (If PKT_CONFIG1:PH_FIELD_SPLIT is cleared, the lengths of the various fields in RX mode are determined by the PKT_FIELD_LENGTH_XX properties, shared between TX and RX modes.)
    • A value of zero in this property means that the field is not used. During RX mode, data will be stored in the RX FIFO until again encountering the first field whose length has been set to zero.
    • It is possible (although not common) to set the length of Field 1 = 0 bytes, as this would indicate transmission/reception of a packet with no Payload data at all.
    • Field 1 cannot be configured as a variable length field, as there is no preceding field that may contain the variable length byte(s).
  • Defaults: 0x00,0x00
  • Register View:
    • PKT_RX_FIELD_1_LENGTH
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x21 0 0 0 RX_FIELD_1_LENGTH[12:8]
    0x22 RX_FIELD_1_LENGTH[7:0]
    Defaults
    0x21 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0
    0x22 0x0

  • Field Details:
    PKT_RX_FIELD_1_LENGTH
    RX_FIELD_1_LENGTH[12:0]
    Description:
    rx_field_length
    Min:
    0x0
    Max:
    0x1fff
    Default:
    0x0

PKT_RX_FIELD_1_CONFIG

  • Group: 0x12
  • Index: 0x23
  • Summary: General data processing and packet configuration bits for RX Field 1.
  • Purpose:
    • Partitioning of the Payload into separate fields is provided to support features such as variable length packets and field-specific data processing (e.g., Manchester encoding, data whitening, etc). This property provides configuration bits for field-specific processing on RX Field 1.
    • This property is not applicable in TX mode.
    • This property is applicable in RX mode only under the following conditions:
    • RX Packet Handling is enabled by clearing PKT_CONFIG1:PH_RX_DISABLE, and
    • PKT_CONFIG1:PH_FIELD_SPLIT is set. If the PH_FIELD_SPLIT bit is cleared, the general packet configuration bits for the various fields in RX mode are determined by the PKT_FIELD_X_CONFIG properties (shared between TX and RX modes).
  • Default: 0x00
  • Register View:
    • PKT_RX_FIELD_1_CONFIG
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x23 0 0 0 4FSK 0 PN_START WHITEN MANCH
    Default
    0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    PKT_RX_FIELD_1_CONFIG
    4FSK
    Description:
    • The chip supports field-specific configuration of (G)FSK modulation modes, i.e., 2(G)FSK across certain fields and 4(G)FSK across other fields. In such a case, the Modem must be configured for 4(G)FSK operation across the entire packet (by setting the MODEM_MOD_TYPE property), and the Packet Handler is then configured on a field-by-field basis to process the data stream from the FIFO as bit pairs (for 4(G)FSK) or single bits (for 2(G)FSK).
    • When 4(G)FSK is enabled across a field, the PH pulls two bits from the FIFO and sends them to the TX Modulator to be transmitted as one-of-four deviation levels.
    • When 4(G)FSK is disabled across a field, the PH pulls one bit from the FIFO and replaces it with the appropriate two bits that map to the outer two deviation levels. Although the TX Modulator remains configured for four levels of deviation (by the MODEM_MOD_TYPE property), using only the outer two deviation levels effectively results in 2(G)FSK modulation across that field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable 4(G)FSK data processing on this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable 4(G)FSK data processing on this field.
    PN_START
    Description:
    • The chip contains a linear feedback shift register (LFSR) for the purpose of generating a pseudo-random number (PN). Data whitening/de-whitening may be obtained by XOR-ing the output from the resulting PN sequence with the data bits of specified fields.
    • This bit controls whether the PN engine is freshly loaded with its seed value (specified in PKT_WHT_SEED_XX) at the start of this field, or whether the PN engine continues calculation from its last state (i.e., from the previous packet). Note: the seed value for the PN engine may only be loaded at the start of Field 1; it is not possible to re-load the seed value at any other place in the packet.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 1 Continue PN generation using last state from previous packet.
    ENUM_1 1 Load PN engine with the seed value at the start of Field 1.
    WHITEN
    Description:
    • The data whitening/de-whitening function is only available when automatic Packet Handling is enabled (e.g., when using the TX FIFO as the modulation source in TX mode, or when the PH_RX_DISABLE bit in the PKT_CONFIG1 property is cleared in RX mode).
    • In RX mode, the data de-whitening function is performed only on bits stored in the RX FIFO; received data bits observed in real-time (on a GPIO pin) are output prior to de-whitening.
    • Enabling data whitening does not affect the over-the-air data rate.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable data whitening/de-whitening on this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable data whitening/de-whitening on this field.
    MANCH
    Description:
    • Manchester encoding operates by replacing each bit with a two-chip pattern (e.g., each '0' bit with a '10' pattern and each '1' bit with a '01' bit pattern, or vice versa). The desired encoding polarity is selected by PKT_CONFIG1:MANCH_POL.
    • Enabling Manchester encoding in one or more fields does not affect the over-the-air data rate; each bit/chip within the entire packet is transmitted at the same data rate (specified by the MODEM_DATA_RATE_X properties). Manchester encoding simply affects the number of bits/chips that are sent (e.g., by replacing one bit with two chips).
    • In RX mode, the Manchester decoding function is performed only on bits stored in the RX FIFO; received data bits observed in real-time (on a GPIO pin) are output prior to decoding.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable Manchester decoding on this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable Manchester decoding on this field.

PKT_RX_FIELD_1_CRC_CONFIG

  • Group: 0x12
  • Index: 0x24
  • Summary: Configuration of CRC control bits across RX Field 1.
  • Purpose:
    • This property is use to control the calculation, transmission, and checking of CRC across RX Field 1.
  • Default: 0x00
  • Register View:
    • PKT_RX_FIELD_1_CRC_CONFIG
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x24 CRC_START ALT_CRC_START 0 0 CHECK_CRC CHECK_ALT_CRC CRC_ENABLE ALT_CRC_ENABLE
    Default
    0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    PKT_RX_FIELD_1_CRC_CONFIG
    CRC_START
    Description:
    • The chip contains a 32-bit CRC engine that may be configured for a variety of polynomials and seed values (refer to the PKT_CRC_CONFIG property). This bit controls whether the CRC engine is freshly loaded with its seed value (PKT_CRC_CONFIG:CRC_SEED) at the start of this field, or whether the CRC engine continues calculation from its last state (i.e., from the previous packet). Note: the seed value for the CRC engine may only be loaded at the start of Field 1. It is not possible to re-load the seed value at any other place in the packet.
    • This bit is only applicable if in RX mode and PKT_CONFIG1:PH_FIELD_SPLIT is set. If the PH_FIELD_SPLIT bit is cleared, this bit is ignored and the CRC_START functionality is obtained from the appropriate PKT_FIELD_X_CRC_CONFIG property.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Continue CRC calculation using the last state from the previous packet.
    ENUM_1 1 Load the CRC engine with the seed value at the start of this field using PKT_CRC_CONFIG:CRC_SEED.
    ALT_CRC_START
    Description:
    The chip contains a 16-bit CRC engine that may be configured for a variety of polynomials and seed values (refer to the PKT_CRC_CONFIG property). This bit controls whether the CRC engine is freshly loaded with its seed value (PKT_CRC_CONFIG:CRC_SEED) at the start of this field, or whether the CRC engine continues calculation from its last state (i.e., from the previous packet). Note: the seed value for the ALT CRC engine may only be loaded at the start of Field 1. It is not possible to re-load the seed value at any other place in the packet.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    CONTINUE 0 Continue 16-bit CRC calculation using the last state from the previous packet.
    LOAD 1 Load 16-bit CRC engine with seed value at the start of this field using PKT_CRC_CONFIG:CRC_SEED.
    CHECK_CRC
    Description:
    This determines whether the accumulated CRC checksum will be checked at the end of this field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Do not check CRC at the end of this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Check CRC at the end of this field.
    CHECK_ALT_CRC
    Description:
    This bit determines whether the accumulated ALT CRC checksum will be checked at the end of this field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Do not check ALT CRC at the end of this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Check ALT CRC at the end of this field.
    CRC_ENABLE
    Description:
    This bit enables CRC checksum calculation over this field. Note: enabling CRC calculation across a field does not automatically result in transmission/checking of the CRC checksum at the end of the field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable CRC calculation over this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable CRC calculation over this field.
    ALT_CRC_ENABLE
    Description:
    This bit enables ALT CRC checksum calculation over this field. Note: enabling ALT CRC calculation across a field does not automatically result in transmission/checking of the ALT CRC checksum at the end of the field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable ALT CRC calculation over this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable ALT CRC calculation over this field.

PKT_RX_FIELD_2_LENGTH

  • Group: 0x12
  • Indexes: 0x25 ... 0x26
  • Summary: Unsigned 13-bit RX Field 2 length value.
  • Purpose:
    • The PKT_RX_FIELD_2_LENGTH properties specify the length of Field 2 in bytes. The field length is an unsigned 13-bit value.
    • RX Field 2 may be configured as a variable length field by setting the appropriate value of PKT_LEN:DST_FIELD; however, it is also necessary that a previous field contain the variable length byte(s). If configured as a variable length field, this property must be set with a value that represents the maximum expected length of the field.
    • Please refer to the text description for PKT_RX_FIELD_1_LENGTH for more details regarding field length configuration.
  • Defaults: 0x00,0x00
  • Register View:
    • PKT_RX_FIELD_2_LENGTH
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x25 0 0 0 RX_FIELD_2_LENGTH[12:8]
    0x26 RX_FIELD_2_LENGTH[7:0]
    Defaults
    0x25 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0
    0x26 0x0

  • Field Details:
    PKT_RX_FIELD_2_LENGTH
    RX_FIELD_2_LENGTH[12:0]
    Description:
    rx_field_length
    Min:
    0x0
    Max:
    0x1fff
    Default:
    0x0

PKT_RX_FIELD_2_CONFIG

  • Group: 0x12
  • Index: 0x27
  • Summary: General data processing and packet configuration bits for RX Field 2.
  • Purpose:
    • Partitioning of the Payload into separate fields is provided to support features such as variable length packets and field-specific data processing (e.g., Manchester encoding, data whitening, etc). This property provides configuration bits for field-specific processing on RX Field 2.
    • This property is not applicable in TX mode.
    • This property is applicable in RX mode only under the following conditions:
    • RX Packet Handling is enabled by clearing PKT_CONFIG1:PH_RX_DISABLE, and
    • PKT_CONFIG1:PH_FIELD_SPLIT is set. If the PH_FIELD_SPLIT bit is cleared, the general packet configuration bits for the various fields in RX mode are determined by the PKT_FIELD_X_CONFIG properties (shared between TX and RX modes).
  • Default: 0x00
  • Register View:
    • PKT_RX_FIELD_2_CONFIG
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x27 0 0 0 4FSK 0 0 WHITEN MANCH
    Default
    0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    PKT_RX_FIELD_2_CONFIG
    4FSK
    Description:
    • The chip supports field-specific configuration of (G)FSK modulation modes, i.e., 2(G)FSK across certain fields and 4(G)FSK across other fields. In such a case, the Modem must be configured for 4(G)FSK operation across the entire packet (by setting the MODEM_MOD_TYPE property), and the Packet Handler is then configured on a field-by-field basis to process the data stream from the FIFO as bit pairs (for 4(G)FSK) or single bits (for 2(G)FSK).
    • When 4(G)FSK is enabled across a field, the PH pulls two bits from the FIFO and sends them to the TX Modulator to be transmitted as one-of-four deviation levels.
    • When 4(G)FSK is disabled across a field, the PH pulls one bit from the FIFO and replaces it with the appropriate two bits that map to the outer two deviation levels. Although the TX Modulator remains configured for four levels of deviation (by the MODEM_MOD_TYPE property), using only the outer two deviation levels effectively results in 2(G)FSK modulation across that field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable 4(G)FSK data processing on this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable 4(G)FSK data processing on this field.
    WHITEN
    Description:
    • The data whitening/de-whitening function is only available when automatic Packet Handling is enabled (e.g., when using the TX FIFO as the modulation source in TX mode, or when the PH_RX_DISABLE bit in the PKT_CONFIG1 property is cleared in RX mode).
    • In RX mode, the data de-whitening function is performed only on bits stored in the RX FIFO; received data bits observed in real-time (on a GPIO pin) are output prior to de-whitening.
    • Enabling data whitening does not affect the over-the-air data rate.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable data whitening/de-whitening on this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable data whitening/de-whitening on this field.
    MANCH
    Description:
    • Manchester encoding operates by replacing each bit with a two-chip pattern (e.g., each '0' bit with a '10' pattern and each '1' bit with a '01' bit pattern, or vice versa). The desired encoding polarity is selected by PKT_CONFIG1:MANCH_POL.
    • Enabling Manchester encoding in one or more fields does not affect the over-the-air data rate; each bit/chip within the entire packet is transmitted at the same data rate (specified by the MODEM_DATA_RATE_X properties). Manchester encoding simply affects the number of bits/chips that are sent (e.g., by replacing one bit with two chips).
    • In RX mode, the Manchester decoding function is performed only on bits stored in the RX FIFO; received data bits observed in real-time (on a GPIO pin) are output prior to decoding.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable Manchester decoding on this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable Manchester decoding on this field.

PKT_RX_FIELD_2_CRC_CONFIG

  • Group: 0x12
  • Index: 0x28
  • Summary: Configuration of CRC control bits across RX Field 2.
  • Purpose:
    • This property is use to control the calculation, transmission, and checking of CRC across RX Field 2.
  • Default: 0x00
  • Register View:
    • PKT_RX_FIELD_2_CRC_CONFIG
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x28 0 0 0 0 CHECK_CRC CHECK_ALT_CRC CRC_ENABLE ALT_CRC_ENABLE
    Default
    0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    PKT_RX_FIELD_2_CRC_CONFIG
    CHECK_CRC
    Description:
    This determines whether the accumulated CRC checksum will be checked at the end of this field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Do not check CRC at the end of this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Check CRC at the end of this field.
    CHECK_ALT_CRC
    Description:
    This bit determines whether the accumulated ALT CRC checksum will be checked at the end of this field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Do not check ALT CRC at the end of this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Check ALT CRC at the end of this field.
    CRC_ENABLE
    Description:
    This bit enables CRC checksum calculation over this field. Note: enabling CRC calculation across a field does not automatically result in transmission/checking of the CRC checksum at the end of the field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable CRC calculation over this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable CRC calculation over this field.
    ALT_CRC_ENABLE
    Description:
    This bit enables ALT CRC checksum calculation over this field. Note: enabling ALT CRC calculation across a field does not automatically result in transmission/checking of the ALT CRC checksum at the end of the field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable ALT CRC calculation over this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable ALT CRC calculation over this field.

PKT_RX_FIELD_3_LENGTH

  • Group: 0x12
  • Indexes: 0x29 ... 0x2a
  • Summary: Unsigned 13-bit RX Field 3 length value.
  • Purpose:
    • The PKT_RX_FIELD_3_LENGTH properties specify the length of Field 3 in bytes. The field length is an unsigned 13-bit value.
    • RX Field 3 may be configured as a variable length field by setting the appropriate value of PKT_LEN:DST_FIELD; however, it is also necessary that a previous field contain the variable length byte(s). If configured as a variable length field, this property must be set with a value that represents the maximum expected length of the field.
    • Please refer to the text description for PKT_RX_FIELD_1_LENGTH for more details regarding field length configuration.
  • Defaults: 0x00,0x00
  • Register View:
    • PKT_RX_FIELD_3_LENGTH
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x29 0 0 0 RX_FIELD_3_LENGTH[12:8]
    0x2a RX_FIELD_3_LENGTH[7:0]
    Defaults
    0x29 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0
    0x2a 0x0

  • Field Details:
    PKT_RX_FIELD_3_LENGTH
    RX_FIELD_3_LENGTH[12:0]
    Description:
    rx_field_length
    Min:
    0x0
    Max:
    0x1fff
    Default:
    0x0

PKT_RX_FIELD_3_CONFIG

  • Group: 0x12
  • Index: 0x2b
  • Summary: General data processing and packet configuration bits for RX Field 3.
  • Purpose:
    • Partitioning of the Payload into separate fields is provided to support features such as variable length packets and field-specific data processing (e.g., Manchester encoding, data whitening, etc). This property provides configuration bits for field-specific processing on RX Field 3.
    • This property is not applicable in TX mode.
    • This property is applicable in RX mode only under the following conditions:
    • RX Packet Handling is enabled by clearing PKT_CONFIG1:PH_RX_DISABLE, and
    • PKT_CONFIG1:PH_FIELD_SPLIT is set. If the PH_FIELD_SPLIT bit is cleared, the general packet configuration bits for the various fields in RX mode are determined by the PKT_FIELD_X_CONFIG properties (shared between TX and RX modes).
  • Default: 0x00
  • Register View:
    • PKT_RX_FIELD_3_CONFIG
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x2b 0 0 0 4FSK 0 0 WHITEN MANCH
    Default
    0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    PKT_RX_FIELD_3_CONFIG
    4FSK
    Description:
    • The chip supports field-specific configuration of (G)FSK modulation modes, i.e., 2(G)FSK across certain fields and 4(G)FSK across other fields. In such a case, the Modem must be configured for 4(G)FSK operation across the entire packet (by setting the MODEM_MOD_TYPE property), and the Packet Handler is then configured on a field-by-field basis to process the data stream from the FIFO as bit pairs (for 4(G)FSK) or single bits (for 2(G)FSK).
    • When 4(G)FSK is enabled across a field, the PH pulls two bits from the FIFO and sends them to the TX Modulator to be transmitted as one-of-four deviation levels.
    • When 4(G)FSK is disabled across a field, the PH pulls one bit from the FIFO and replaces it with the appropriate two bits that map to the outer two deviation levels. Although the TX Modulator remains configured for four levels of deviation (by the MODEM_MOD_TYPE property), using only the outer two deviation levels effectively results in 2(G)FSK modulation across that field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable 4(G)FSK data processing on this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable 4(G)FSK data processing on this field.
    WHITEN
    Description:
    • The data whitening/de-whitening function is only available when automatic Packet Handling is enabled (e.g., when using the TX FIFO as the modulation source in TX mode, or when the PH_RX_DISABLE bit in the PKT_CONFIG1 property is cleared in RX mode).
    • In RX mode, the data de-whitening function is performed only on bits stored in the RX FIFO; received data bits observed in real-time (on a GPIO pin) are output prior to de-whitening.
    • Enabling data whitening does not affect the over-the-air data rate.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable data whitening/de-whitening on this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable data whitening/de-whitening on this field.
    MANCH
    Description:
    • Manchester encoding operates by replacing each bit with a two-chip pattern (e.g., each '0' bit with a '10' pattern and each '1' bit with a '01' bit pattern, or vice versa). The desired encoding polarity is selected by PKT_CONFIG1:MANCH_POL.
    • Enabling Manchester encoding in one or more fields does not affect the over-the-air data rate; each bit/chip within the entire packet is transmitted at the same data rate (specified by the MODEM_DATA_RATE_X properties). Manchester encoding simply affects the number of bits/chips that are sent (e.g., by replacing one bit with two chips).
    • In RX mode, the Manchester decoding function is performed only on bits stored in the RX FIFO; received data bits observed in real-time (on a GPIO pin) are output prior to decoding.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable Manchester decoding on this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable Manchester decoding on this field.

PKT_RX_FIELD_3_CRC_CONFIG

  • Group: 0x12
  • Index: 0x2c
  • Summary: Configuration of CRC control bits across RX Field 3.
  • Purpose:
    • This property is use to control the calculation, transmission, and checking of CRC across RX Field 3.
  • Default: 0x00
  • Register View:
    • PKT_RX_FIELD_3_CRC_CONFIG
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x2c 0 0 0 0 CHECK_CRC CHECK_ALT_CRC CRC_ENABLE ALT_CRC_ENABLE
    Default
    0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    PKT_RX_FIELD_3_CRC_CONFIG
    CHECK_CRC
    Description:
    This determines whether the accumulated CRC checksum will be checked at the end of this field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Do not check CRC at the end of this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Check CRC at the end of this field.
    CHECK_ALT_CRC
    Description:
    This bit determines whether the accumulated ALT CRC checksum will be checked at the end of this field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Do not check ALT CRC at the end of this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Check ALT CRC at the end of this field.
    CRC_ENABLE
    Description:
    This bit enables CRC checksum calculation over this field. Note: enabling CRC calculation across a field does not automatically result in transmission/checking of the CRC checksum at the end of the field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable CRC calculation over this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable CRC calculation over this field.
    ALT_CRC_ENABLE
    Description:
    This bit enables ALT CRC checksum calculation over this field. Note: enabling ALT CRC calculation across a field does not automatically result in transmission/checking of the ALT CRC checksum at the end of the field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable ALT CRC calculation over this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable ALT CRC calculation over this field.

PKT_RX_FIELD_4_LENGTH

  • Group: 0x12
  • Indexes: 0x2d ... 0x2e
  • Summary: Unsigned 13-bit RX Field 4 length value.
  • Purpose:
    • The PKT_RX_FIELD_4_LENGTH properties specify the length of Field 4 in bytes. The field length is an unsigned 13-bit value.
    • RX Field 4 may be configured as a variable length field by setting the appropriate value of PKT_LEN:DST_FIELD; however, it is also necessary that a previous field contain the variable length byte(s). If configured as a variable length field, this property must be set with a value that represents the maximum expected length of the field.
    • Please refer to the text description for PKT_RX_FIELD_1_LENGTH for more details regarding field length configuration.
  • Defaults: 0x00,0x00
  • Register View:
    • PKT_RX_FIELD_4_LENGTH
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x2d 0 0 0 RX_FIELD_4_LENGTH[12:8]
    0x2e RX_FIELD_4_LENGTH[7:0]
    Defaults
    0x2d 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0
    0x2e 0x0

  • Field Details:
    PKT_RX_FIELD_4_LENGTH
    RX_FIELD_4_LENGTH[12:0]
    Description:
    rx_field_length
    Min:
    0x0
    Max:
    0x1fff
    Default:
    0x0

PKT_RX_FIELD_4_CONFIG

  • Group: 0x12
  • Index: 0x2f
  • Summary: General data processing and packet configuration bits for RX Field 4.
  • Purpose:
    • Partitioning of the Payload into separate fields is provided to support features such as variable length packets and field-specific data processing (e.g., Manchester encoding, data whitening, etc). This property provides configuration bits for field-specific processing on RX Field 4.
    • This property is not applicable in TX mode.
    • This property is applicable in RX mode only under the following conditions:
    • RX Packet Handling is enabled by clearing PKT_CONFIG1:PH_RX_DISABLE, and
    • PKT_CONFIG1:PH_FIELD_SPLIT is set. If the PH_FIELD_SPLIT bit is cleared, the general packet configuration bits for the various fields in RX mode are determined by the PKT_FIELD_X_CONFIG properties (shared between TX and RX modes).
  • Default: 0x00
  • Register View:
    • PKT_RX_FIELD_4_CONFIG
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x2f 0 0 0 4FSK 0 0 WHITEN MANCH
    Default
    0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    PKT_RX_FIELD_4_CONFIG
    4FSK
    Description:
    • The chip supports field-specific configuration of (G)FSK modulation modes, i.e., 2(G)FSK across certain fields and 4(G)FSK across other fields. In such a case, the Modem must be configured for 4(G)FSK operation across the entire packet (by setting the MODEM_MOD_TYPE property), and the Packet Handler is then configured on a field-by-field basis to process the data stream from the FIFO as bit pairs (for 4(G)FSK) or single bits (for 2(G)FSK).
    • When 4(G)FSK is enabled across a field, the PH pulls two bits from the FIFO and sends them to the TX Modulator to be transmitted as one-of-four deviation levels.
    • When 4(G)FSK is disabled across a field, the PH pulls one bit from the FIFO and replaces it with the appropriate two bits that map to the outer two deviation levels. Although the TX Modulator remains configured for four levels of deviation (by the MODEM_MOD_TYPE property), using only the outer two deviation levels effectively results in 2(G)FSK modulation across that field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable 4(G)FSK data processing on this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable 4(G)FSK data processing on this field.
    WHITEN
    Description:
    • The data whitening/de-whitening function is only available when automatic Packet Handling is enabled (e.g., when using the TX FIFO as the modulation source in TX mode, or when the PH_RX_DISABLE bit in the PKT_CONFIG1 property is cleared in RX mode).
    • In RX mode, the data de-whitening function is performed only on bits stored in the RX FIFO; received data bits observed in real-time (on a GPIO pin) are output prior to de-whitening.
    • Enabling data whitening does not affect the over-the-air data rate.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable data whitening/de-whitening on this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable data whitening/de-whitening on this field.
    MANCH
    Description:
    • Manchester encoding operates by replacing each bit with a two-chip pattern (e.g., each '0' bit with a '10' pattern and each '1' bit with a '01' bit pattern, or vice versa). The desired encoding polarity is selected by PKT_CONFIG1:MANCH_POL.
    • Enabling Manchester encoding in one or more fields does not affect the over-the-air data rate; each bit/chip within the entire packet is transmitted at the same data rate (specified by the MODEM_DATA_RATE_X properties). Manchester encoding simply affects the number of bits/chips that are sent (e.g., by replacing one bit with two chips).
    • In RX mode, the Manchester decoding function is performed only on bits stored in the RX FIFO; received data bits observed in real-time (on a GPIO pin) are output prior to decoding.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable Manchester decoding on this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable Manchester decoding on this field.

PKT_RX_FIELD_4_CRC_CONFIG

  • Group: 0x12
  • Index: 0x30
  • Summary: Configuration of CRC control bits across RX Field 4.
  • Purpose:
    • This property is use to control the calculation, transmission, and checking of CRC across RX Field 4.
  • Default: 0x00
  • Register View:
    • PKT_RX_FIELD_4_CRC_CONFIG
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x30 0 0 0 0 CHECK_CRC CHECK_ALT_CRC CRC_ENABLE ALT_CRC_ENABLE
    Default
    0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    PKT_RX_FIELD_4_CRC_CONFIG
    CHECK_CRC
    Description:
    This determines whether the accumulated CRC checksum will be checked at the end of this field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Do not check CRC at the end of this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Check CRC at the end of this field.
    CHECK_ALT_CRC
    Description:
    This bit determines whether the accumulated ALT CRC checksum will be checked at the end of this field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Do not check ALT CRC at the end of this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Check ALT CRC at the end of this field.
    CRC_ENABLE
    Description:
    This bit enables CRC checksum calculation over this field. Note: enabling CRC calculation across a field does not automatically result in transmission/checking of the CRC checksum at the end of the field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable CRC calculation over this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable CRC calculation over this field.
    ALT_CRC_ENABLE
    Description:
    This bit enables ALT CRC checksum calculation over this field. Note: enabling ALT CRC calculation across a field does not automatically result in transmission/checking of the ALT CRC checksum at the end of the field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable ALT CRC calculation over this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable ALT CRC calculation over this field.

PKT_RX_FIELD_5_LENGTH

  • Group: 0x12
  • Indexes: 0x31 ... 0x32
  • Summary: Unsigned 13-bit RX Field 5 length value.
  • Purpose:
    • The PKT_RX_FIELD_5_LENGTH properties specify the length of Field 5 in bytes. The field length is an unsigned 13-bit value.
    • RX Field 5 may be configured as a variable length field by setting the appropriate value of PKT_LEN:DST_FIELD; however, it is also necessary that a previous field contain the variable length byte(s). If configured as a variable length field, this property must be set with a value that represents the maximum expected length of the field.
    • Please refer to the text description for PKT_RX_FIELD_1_LENGTH for more details regarding field length configuration.
  • Defaults: 0x00,0x00
  • Register View:
    • PKT_RX_FIELD_5_LENGTH
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x31 0 0 0 RX_FIELD_5_LENGTH[12:8]
    0x32 RX_FIELD_5_LENGTH[7:0]
    Defaults
    0x31 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0
    0x32 0x0

  • Field Details:
    PKT_RX_FIELD_5_LENGTH
    RX_FIELD_5_LENGTH[12:0]
    Description:
    rx_field_length
    Min:
    0x0
    Max:
    0x1fff
    Default:
    0x0

PKT_RX_FIELD_5_CONFIG

  • Group: 0x12
  • Index: 0x33
  • Summary: General data processing and packet configuration bits for RX Field 5.
  • Purpose:
    • Partitioning of the Payload into separate fields is provided to support features such as variable length packets and field-specific data processing (e.g., Manchester encoding, data whitening, etc). This property provides configuration bits for field-specific processing on RX Field 5.
    • This property is not applicable in TX mode.
    • This property is applicable in RX mode only under the following conditions:
    • RX Packet Handling is enabled by clearing PKT_CONFIG1:PH_RX_DISABLE, and
    • PKT_CONFIG1:PH_FIELD_SPLIT is set. If the PH_FIELD_SPLIT bit is cleared, the general packet configuration bits for the various fields in RX mode are determined by the PKT_FIELD_X_CONFIG properties (shared between TX and RX modes).
  • Default: 0x00
  • Register View:
    • PKT_RX_FIELD_5_CONFIG
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x33 0 0 0 4FSK 0 0 WHITEN MANCH
    Default
    0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    PKT_RX_FIELD_5_CONFIG
    4FSK
    Description:
    • The chip supports field-specific configuration of (G)FSK modulation modes, i.e., 2(G)FSK across certain fields and 4(G)FSK across other fields. In such a case, the Modem must be configured for 4(G)FSK operation across the entire packet (by setting the MODEM_MOD_TYPE property), and the Packet Handler is then configured on a field-by-field basis to process the data stream from the FIFO as bit pairs (for 4(G)FSK) or single bits (for 2(G)FSK).
    • When 4(G)FSK is enabled across a field, the PH pulls two bits from the FIFO and sends them to the TX Modulator to be transmitted as one-of-four deviation levels.
    • When 4(G)FSK is disabled across a field, the PH pulls one bit from the FIFO and replaces it with the appropriate two bits that map to the outer two deviation levels. Although the TX Modulator remains configured for four levels of deviation (by the MODEM_MOD_TYPE property), using only the outer two deviation levels effectively results in 2(G)FSK modulation across that field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable 4(G)FSK data processing on this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable 4(G)FSK data processing on this field.
    WHITEN
    Description:
    • The data whitening/de-whitening function is only available when automatic Packet Handling is enabled (e.g., when using the TX FIFO as the modulation source in TX mode, or when the PH_RX_DISABLE bit in the PKT_CONFIG1 property is cleared in RX mode).
    • In RX mode, the data de-whitening function is performed only on bits stored in the RX FIFO; received data bits observed in real-time (on a GPIO pin) are output prior to de-whitening.
    • Enabling data whitening does not affect the over-the-air data rate.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable data whitening/de-whitening on this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable data whitening/de-whitening on this field.
    MANCH
    Description:
    • Manchester encoding operates by replacing each bit with a two-chip pattern (e.g., each '0' bit with a '10' pattern and each '1' bit with a '01' bit pattern, or vice versa). The desired encoding polarity is selected by PKT_CONFIG1:MANCH_POL.
    • Enabling Manchester encoding in one or more fields does not affect the over-the-air data rate; each bit/chip within the entire packet is transmitted at the same data rate (specified by the MODEM_DATA_RATE_X properties). Manchester encoding simply affects the number of bits/chips that are sent (e.g., by replacing one bit with two chips).
    • In RX mode, the Manchester decoding function is performed only on bits stored in the RX FIFO; received data bits observed in real-time (on a GPIO pin) are output prior to decoding.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Disable Manchester decoding on this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Enable Manchester decoding on this field.

PKT_RX_FIELD_5_CRC_CONFIG

  • Group: 0x12
  • Index: 0x34
  • Summary: Configuration of CRC control bits across RX Field 5.
  • Purpose:
    • This property is use to control the calculation, transmission, and checking of CRC across RX Field 5.
  • Default: 0x00
  • Register View:
    • PKT_RX_FIELD_5_CRC_CONFIG
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x34 0 0 0 0 CHECK_CRC CHECK_ALT_CRC CRC_ENABLE ALT_CRC_ENABLE
    Default
    0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    PKT_RX_FIELD_5_CRC_CONFIG
    CHECK_CRC
    Description:
    This determines whether the accumulated CRC checksum will be checked at the end of this field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Do not check CRC at the end of this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Check CRC at the end of this field.
    CHECK_ALT_CRC
    Description:
    This bit determines whether the accumulated ALT CRC checksum will be checked at the end of this field.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Do not check ALT CRC at the end of this field.
    ENUM_1 1 Check ALT CRC at the end of this field.
    CRC_ENABLE
    Description:
    This bit enables CRC checksum calculation over this field. Note: enabling CRC calculation across a field does not automatically result in transmission/checking of the CRC checksum at the end of the field.
    Format:

    ENUM_1 1 Enable CRC calculation over this field.

PKT_CRC_SEED

  • Group: 0x12
  • Indexes: 0x36 ... 0x39
  • Summary: 32-bit seed value for the 32-bit CRC engine
  • Purpose:
    • This property defines the starting seed value for the 32-bit CRC engine.
    • The value in this field is used when PKT_CRC_CONFIG:CRC_SEED is set to zero.
  • Defaults: 0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00
  • Register View:
    • PKT_CRC_SEED
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x36 CRC_SEED[31:24]
    0x37 CRC_SEED[23:16]
    0x38 CRC_SEED[15:8]
    0x39 CRC_SEED[7:0]
    Defaults
    0x36 0x0
    0x37 0x0
    0x38 0x0
    0x39 0x0

  • Field Details:
    PKT_CRC_SEED
    CRC_SEED[31:0]
    Description:
    Defines the 32-bit PN seed value.
    Min:
    0x0
    Max:
    0xffffffff
    Default:
    0x0

MODEM

MODEM_MOD_TYPE

  • Group: 0x20
  • Index: 0x00
  • Summary: Selects the type of modulation. In TX mode, additionally selects the source of the modulation.
  • Purpose:
    • This property configures the Modem in the chip for transmission/reception of the following modulation types: OOK, 2(G)FSK, and 4(G)FSK (if supported) modulation.
    • In TX mode, this property is additionally used to select the source of the TX data stream, and whether that TX data stream is from a synchronous or asynchronous source (in Direct mode only).
    • The Modem must be configured for transmission/reception of only one type of modulation throughout the entire packet; it is not possible (for example) to use OOK modulation over certain fields and (G)FSK modulation over other fields. If 4(G)FSK is supported, it is possible to switch between 2(G)FSK and 4(G)FSK on a field-specific basis; however, this is accomplished by configuring the Modem to 4(G)FSK mode for the entire packet and then performing special data processing in the Packet Handler.
  • Default: 0x02
  • Register View:
    • MODEM_MOD_TYPE
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x00 TX_DIRECT_MODE_TYPE TX_DIRECT_MODE_GPIO MOD_SOURCE MOD_TYPE
    Default
    0x0 0x0 0x0 0x2

  • Field Details:
    MODEM_MOD_TYPE
    TX_DIRECT_MODE_TYPE
    Description:
    • This bit determines whether a real-time TX data stream (applied to the chip on a selected GPIO input pin) is processed in synchronous or asynchronous fashion. This bit is applicable only in TX mode, and only when the MOD_SOURCE field is also set for TX Direct mode.
    • In TX Direct Synchronous mode, the chip controls the transmit data rate by outputting a TX bit clock (GPIO_PIN_CFG=0x10). The host MCU receives the rising edge of the TX clock and responds by outputting one bit for each clock tick; the chip clocks in this new data bit on the subsequent falling edge of the TX clock. All 2-level modulation modes (OOK, 2FSK, 2GFSK) are supported.
    • In TX Direct Asynchronous mode, the host MCU controls the transmit data rate; the RFIC has no knowledge of the rate of the incoming TX data stream but simply oversamples the data as fast as possible to determine the bit edge transitions. OOK and 2FSK are supported, but 2GFSK is not supported in this mode.
    • 4(G)FSK is not supported in either TX Direct Synchronous or TX Direct Asynchronous modes.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    SYNC 0 Direct mode operates in synchronous mode, applies to TX only.
    ASYNC 1 Direct mode operates in asynchronous mode, applies to TX only. GFSK is not supported.
    TX_DIRECT_MODE_GPIO[1:0]
    Description:
    • This field determines which GPIO pin is selected by the Modem as the modulation data source during TX Direct mode. This bit is applicable only in TX mode, and only when the MOD_SOURCE field is also set for TX Direct mode.
    • This field does not automatically configure the selected GPIO pin as a digital input pin; it remains necessary to additionally configure the desired GPIO pin as a CMOS-compatible input pin by setting GPIO_PIN_CFG=0x04.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    GPIO0 0 TX direct mode uses GPIO0 as data source.
    GPIO1 1 TX direct mode uses GPIO1 as data source.
    GPIO2 2 TX direct mode uses GPIO2 as data source.
    GPIO3 3 TX direct mode uses GPIO3 as data source.
    MOD_SOURCE[1:0]
    Description:
    This bit selects the source of modulation during TX mode. It is applicable only in TX mode.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    PACKET 0 The modulation is sourced from the TX FIFO in the packet handler. revB1A
    DIRECT 1 The modulation is sourced in real-time (i.e., TX Direct Mode) from a GPIO pin, as selected by the TX_DIRECT_MODE_GPIO field. revB1A
    PSEUDO 2 The modulation is sourced from the internal pseudo-random generator. revB1A
    MOD_TYPE[2:0]
    Description:
    • This field configures the Modem for transmission or reception of the desired type of modulation.
    • With the exception of CW mode (a TX-only function), this bit is applicable in both TX and RX modes.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    CW 0 CW.
    OOK 1 OOK.
    2FSK 2 2FSK.
    2GFSK 3 2GFSK.
    4FSK 4 4FSK.
    4GFSK 5 4GFSK.

MODEM_MAP_CONTROL

  • Group: 0x20
  • Index: 0x01
  • Summary: Controls polarity and mapping of transmit and receive bits.
  • Purpose:
    • The chip provides the ability to invert the polarity of the TX and RX data bits. This flexibility is provided to ensure compatibility of the chip with other legacy systems that may have a different definition of data bit polarity.
    • The ENMANCH bit signals the chip to adjust the "search for Sync Word" timeout period in the event that the Sync Word is configured for simultaneous Manchester coding and 4(G)FSK coding. This configuration is currently not supported and thus the setting of the ENMANCH bit is internally ignored.
  • Default: 0x80
  • Register View:
    • MODEM_MAP_CONTROL
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x01 ENMANCH ENINV_RXBIT ENINV_TXBIT ENINV_FD 0 0 0 0
    Default
    0x1 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    MODEM_MAP_CONTROL
    ENMANCH
    Description:
    • When set, signals the chip adjust the "search for Sync Word" timeout period in the event that the Sync Word field is simultaneously configured for Manchester coding and 4(G)FSK coding.
    • This configuration is currently not supported; the setting of the ENMANCH bit is internally ignored.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Do not adjust Sync Word timeout for Manchester coding.
    ENUM_1 1 Adjust Sync Word timeout for Manchester coding.
    ENINV_RXBIT
    Description:
    • Enables/disables inversion of the entire RX data bit stream, occurring at the circuit point just after the Demodulator and prior to any subsequent decoding (e.g., Manchester decoding or data de-whitening).
    • The data bits appearing in real-time on a GPIO pin (if selected) will be inverted, as will the data bytes stored in the RX FIFO.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Do not invert RX data bits.
    ENUM_1 1 Invert RX data bits.
    ENINV_TXBIT
    Description:
    • Enables/disables inversion of the entire TX data bit stream, occurring at the circuit point just prior to injection into the Modulator. The inversion of the data bit stream applies to all three possible sources of TX modulation (FIFO, Direct from GPIO pin, or PN generator).
    • In OOK mode, this has the obvious effect of changing a TX-ON bit to a TX-OFF bit, and vice versa.
    • In 2(G)FSK mode, this has the obvious effect of changing a +Fdev bit to a -Fdev bit, and vice versa.
    • The default setting of this bit (i.e., non-inversion) results in a '1' TX data bit mapping to the +Fdev deviation level.
    • In 4(G)FSK mode, the resulting effect depends upon the selected symbol mapping; that is, inverting a pair of TX data bits (that previously mapped to one 4(G)FSK deviation level) may not result in transmission of the opposite deviation level.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Do not invert TX data bits.
    ENUM_1 1 Invert TX data bits.
    ENINV_FD
    Description:
    • Enables/disables inversion of the polarity of frequency deviation in TX 2(G)FSK or 4(G)FSK mode. This bit has no effect in TX OOK mode or RX mode.
    • In 2(G)FSK mode, this bit has the same effect as inverting the TX data bit stream through the ENINV_TXBIT.
    • In 4(G)FSK mode, this bit results in inversion of the modulation waveform; this may differ from inverting the TX data bit stream (through the ENINV_TXBIT), depending upon the selected symbol mapping.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Do not invert the polarity of the frequency deviation.
    ENUM_1 1 Invert the polarity of the frequency deviation.

MODEM_DSM_CTRL

  • Group: 0x20
  • Index: 0x02
  • Summary: Miscellaneous control bits for the Delta-Sigma Modulator (DSM) in the PLL Synthesizer.
  • Purpose:
    • This property provides several miscellaneous control bits for DSM functions such as clock source, dithering, and modulator order. These control bits are primarily intended for engineering diagnostic purposes, and Silicon Labs does not recommend altering the values suggested by the WDS Calculator (with the possible exception of the DSM_LSB bit).
    • Some DSM Fractional-N PLL Synthesizers may exhibit discrete tones or pattern-related spurs for certain fractional values of the frequency control word. A common method of breaking up these tones or patterns is to add a noise-like (pseudo-random) bit sequence to the LSB of the frequency control word; this is known as "dithering". The chip provides for enabling dithering and selection of two different types of dithering; however, Silicon Labs has not observed a need to enable this functionality and recommends that dithering remain disabled.
    • The fractional frequency values that commonly give rise to pattern-related spurs in many DSMs are exact powers-of-2 (e.g., 0.5, 0.25, 0.125, etc). In addition to dithering, another common method of eliminating pattern-related spurs is to simply ensure that the frequency control word is always an odd value, and thus can never be an exact power-of-2. The chip provides for internally forcing the LSB of the frequency control word to always be set high, thus resulting in an odd value (regardless of the frequency control word programmed by the user). This functionality is controlled by the DSM_LSB bit. The downside of obtaining only odd values of the frequency control word is that the frequency tuning resolution is effectively degraded by a factor of 2x (e.g., 57.22 Hz tuning resolution in the 915M band instead of 28.61 Hz tuning resolution). Silicon Labs is not aware of a need for enabling this functionality as no significant pattern-related spurs have been observed; however, the WDS Calculator currently suggests setting this bit and absent a need for extremely fine frequency tuning resolution, Silicon Labs recommends not altering this setting.
  • Default: 0x07
  • Register View:
    • MODEM_DSM_CTRL
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x02 DSMCLK_SEL DSM_MODE DSMDT_EN DSMDTTP DSM_RST DSM_LSB DSM_ORDER
    Default
    0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x1 0x3

  • Field Details:
    MODEM_DSM_CTRL
    DSMCLK_SEL
    Description:
    Selects the clock source for the DSM.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 DSM clock comes from 30 MHz PLL feedback clock.
    ENUM_1 1 DSM clock comes from 30 MHz crystal clock.
    DSM_MODE
    Description:
    Selects the type of DSM used in the PLL Synthesizer.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 MASH 1-1-1 DSM will be selected.
    ENUM_1 1 A single loop DSM will be selected.
    DSMDT_EN
    Description:
    • Selects whether dithering is enabled in the DSM.
    • When enabled, the type of dithering is controlled by the DSMDTTP bit.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 DSM dithering is disabled.
    ENUM_1 1 DSM dithering is enabled.
    DSMDTTP
    Description:
    • Selects the type of dithering added to the DSM.
    • The bits of the pseudo-random dithering sequence may be viewed as +1/0 bits or as +1/-1 bits; the latter method is DC-balanced while the former method effectively adds ½ LSB of frequency offset to the frequency control word.
    • This bit has no effect unless dithering is enabled by setting the DSMDT_EN bit.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 +1/0 is added to DSM input LSB.
    ENUM_1 1 +1/-1 is added to DSM input LSB.
    DSM_RST
    Description:
    Provides a method of resetting the DSM.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENABLE 0 DSM is in operational state (reset is not active).
    RESET 1 DSM will be in reset state until it is clear.
    DSM_LSB
    Description:
    • Selects whether the LSB of the DSM frequency control word is always forced high, resulting in odd values of the frequency control word.
    • If enabled, the effective frequency tuning resolution is degraded.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 The LSB of the DSM input is unaltered
    ENUM_1 1 The LSB of the DSM input is internally forced high (i.e., the frequency control word is forced to always be an odd value).
    DSM_ORDER[1:0]
    Description:
    Selects the order of the DSM.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 0 order, with 0 output continuously.
    ENUM_1 1 1st order, with no noise shaping.
    ENUM_2 2 2nd order, MASH 1-1.
    ENUM_3 3 3rd order, MASH 1-1-1.

MODEM_DATA_RATE

  • Group: 0x20
  • Indexes: 0x03 ... 0x05
  • Summary: Unsigned 24-bit value used to determine the TX data rate
  • Purpose:
    • The TX data rate is derived from an internal clock signal from the TX Numerically Controlled Oscillator (NCO).
    • The TX NCO provides a clock signal at a configurable multiple of the final desired TX data rate; the exact oversampling ratio depends upon the modulation mode (OOK / FSK / GFSK) and selected data rate.
    • The value of the MODEM_DATA_RATE property works in conjunction with the MODEM_TX_NCO_MODE property and TXOSR field to provide the desired data rate. As a result, the units of the MODEM_DATA_RATE property are not fixed. However, as a general guideline, the value of the MODEM_DATA_RATE property will be either 1x, 2x, 4x, 10x, 20x, or 40x the desired data rate (in bits per second).
    • Please refer to the text description for MODEM_TX_NCO_MODE for more details regarding the TX Numerically Controlled Oscillator (NCO), and the roles of the MODEM_TX_NCO_MODE and MODEM_DATA_RATE properties in setting the TX data rate.
    • The default values of the MODEM_DATA_RATE and MODEM_TX_NCO_MODE properties result in a data rate of 100 kbps.
  • Defaults: 0x0f,0x42,0x40
  • Register View:
    • MODEM_DATA_RATE
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x03 DATA_RATE[23:16]
    0x04 DATA_RATE[15:8]
    0x05 DATA_RATE[7:0]
    Defaults
    0x03 0xf
    0x04 0x42
    0x05 0x40

  • Field Details:
    MODEM_DATA_RATE
    DATA_RATE[23:0]
    Description:
    Data rate
    Min:
    0x0
    Max:
    0xffffff
    Default:
    0xf4240

MODEM_TX_NCO_MODE

  • Group: 0x20
  • Indexes: 0x06 ... 0x09
  • Summary: TX Gaussian filter oversampling ratio and Byte 3 of unsigned 26-bit TX Numerically Controlled Oscillator (NCO) modulus.
  • Purpose:
    • The chip contains a TX Numerically Controlled Oscillator (NCO) for the purpose of creating an internal clock signal at a configurable multiple of the desired data rate.
    • For 2GFSK and 4GFSK modes of operation, the oversampling ratio is configured by the TXOSR field and is selectable between 10x, 20x, and 40x. The oversampled NCO clock signal is used to synthesize the individual deviation steps of the Gaussian filtered modulation waveform, and thus necessarily must be at a higher multiple of the desired data rate.
    • For OOK, 2FSK, and 4FSK modes of operation, there is no inherent need to create an oversampled clock; the only required signal is the TXCLK signal at the desired data rate. However, it is convenient to use the same NCO clock circuitry and thus the TXCLK data rate signal is obtained by first generating an NCO clock signal at an oversampling ratio of 10x and then subsequently dividing-by-10.
    • The NCO is comprised of an accumulator that is clocked by the crystal oscillator frequency (Fxtal), has a maximum count limit (modulus) equal to the value of the MODEM_TX_NCO_MODE property, and on each clock tick accumulates a value set by the MODEM_DATA_RATE property. Thus the accumulator wraps over its maximum count limit at a rate given by the formula:



      The overflow pulses generated by the accumulator are the TX NCO clock signal.
    • The actual TX data rate (and frequency of the TXCLK signal) is given by the formula:



    • In 2GFSK or 4GFSK mode, the TXOSR value may be increased to 20x or 40x (from its nominal value of 10x). This increase in oversampling rate results in a Gaussian filtered modulation waveform with finer deviation steps, and thus reduces the modulation sideband artifacts. The 20x or 40x oversampling rate options are only available at lower data rates; the WDS Calculator will automatically suggest the highest possible value of TXOSR for the selected data rate. If an oversampling rate of 20x or 40x is selected, the value entered for the MODEM_DATA_RATE property should also be scaled by 2x or 4x (respectively), in order to maintain the desired TX data rate.
    • The value entered for the MODEM_TX_NCO_MODE property is recommended to be either Fxtal or Fxtal/10 (e.g., 0x1C9C380 = 30M decimal, or 0x02DC6C0 =3M decimal, assuming the crystal frequency is 30 MHz). The WDS Calculator will automatically suggest the appropriate value as a function of data rate (Fxtal for DR > 200kbps, and Fxtal/10 for DR ≥ 200kbps). This provides a different adjustment resolution of the data rate.
    • The MODEM_TX_NCO_MODE and MODEM_DATA_RATE properties affect only the TX data rate, and have no effect in configuring the data rate in RX mode.
    • The default values of the MODEM_DATA_RATE and MODEM_TX_NCO_MODE properties result in a data rate of 100 kbps.
  • Defaults: 0x01,0xc9,0xc3,0x80
  • Register View:
    • MODEM_TX_NCO_MODE
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x06 0 0 0 0 TXOSR[1:0] NCOMOD[25:24]
    0x07 NCOMOD[23:16]
    0x08 NCOMOD[15:8]
    0x09 NCOMOD[7:0]
    Defaults
    0x06 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x1
    0x07 0xc9
    0x08 0xc3
    0x09 0x80

  • Field Details:
    MODEM_TX_NCO_MODE
    TXOSR[1:0]
    Description:
    Sets the oversampling ratio of the internal NCO clock signal used to synthesize the Gaussian filtered modulation waveform. This field is only effective in GFSK mode.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 TX Gaussian filter oversampling ratio is 10x.
    ENUM_1 1 TX Gaussian filter oversampling ratio is 40x.
    ENUM_2 2 TX Gaussian filter oversampling ratio is 20x.
    ENUM_3 3 Reserved, do not use.
    NCOMOD[25:0]
    Description:
    Sets the modulus (maximum count value) of the accumulator used in the TX NCO clock generation circuitry.
    Min:
    0x0
    Max:
    0x3ffffff
    Default:
    0x1c9c380

MODEM_FREQ_DEV

  • Group: 0x20
  • Indexes: 0x0a ... 0x0c
  • Summary: 17-bit unsigned TX frequency deviation word.
  • Purpose:
    • The TX frequency deviation is specified by an unsigned 17-bit value. This property defines the frequency deviation value.
    • The units of the MODEM_FREQ_DEV property are in increments of the LSB tuning resolution of the PLL Synthesizer, and are therefore a function of the crystal frequency and output frequency band. The formula for calculating the value of the MODEM_FREQ_DEV property is given by the following equation:




    • The output divider value OUTDIV is configured as a function of the desired frequency band, and is specified in property MODEM_CLKGEN_BAND:BAND.
    • The prescaler divider value NPRESC is configured as a function of the selected synthesizer performance mode and may take on the values NPRESC=2 or NPRESC=4, as specified in property MODEM_CLKGEN_BAND:SY_SEL.
    • For 2(G)FSK mode, the specified value is the peak deviation. For 4(G)FSK mode (if supported), the specified value is the inner deviation (i.e., between channel center frequency and the nearest symbol deviation level).
    • The MODEM_FREQ_DEV property are only used in TX mode.
  • Defaults: 0x00,0x06,0xd3
  • Register View:
    • MODEM_FREQ_DEV
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x0a 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 FREQDEV
    0x0b FREQDEV[15:8]
    0x0c FREQDEV[7:0]
    Defaults
    0x0a 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0
    0x0b 0x6
    0x0c 0xd3

  • Field Details:
    MODEM_FREQ_DEV
    FREQDEV[16:0]
    Default:
    0x6d3

MODEM_FREQ_OFFSET

  • Group: 0x20
  • Indexes: 0x0d ... 0x0e
  • Summary: Frequency offset adjustment (a 16-bit signed number).
  • Purpose:
    • In TX mode, the MODEM_FREQ_OFFSET value is used to provide an offset to the programmed TX frequency. This allows fine tuning of the TX frequency to account for the variability of the TX reference frequency (e.g., crystal oscillator frequency error).
    • In RX mode when PLL AFC is disabled, the MODEM_FREQ_OFFSET value is used to provide an offset for the programmed RX frequency. This property has no function in RX mode with PLL AFC enabled. Specifically, reading this property does NOT return the estimated AFC frequency error in RX mode; that frequency error value may be obtained from the GET_MODEM_STATUS command.
    • The frequency offset adjustment is a signed 16-bit value. This property defines the frequency offset value.
    • The units of the MODEM_FREQ_OFFSET property are in increments of the LSB tuning resolution of the PLL Synthesizer, and are therefore a function of the crystal reference frequency and output frequency band. The formula for calculating the value of the MODEM_FREQ_OFFSET property is given by the following equation:




    • Please refer to the text description for FREQ_CONTROL_INTE for more details regarding frequency calculation.
    • The absolute range of this property expressed in Hz is a function of the crystal reference frequency and output frequency band, but ranges from +/-937.5 kHz in the 915M band to +/-468.7 kHz in the 450M band, etc.
  • Defaults: 0x00,0x00
  • Register View:
    • MODEM_FREQ_OFFSET
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x0d FREQOFFSET[15:8]
    0x0e FREQOFFSET[7:0]
    Defaults
    0x0d 0x0
    0x0e 0x0

  • Field Details:
    MODEM_FREQ_OFFSET
    FREQOFFSET[15:0]
    Default:
    0x0

MODEM_TX_FILTER_COEFF_8

  • Group: 0x20
  • Index: 0x0f
  • Summary: The 8th coefficient of TX spectral shaping filter.
  • Purpose:
    • The chip can apply a spectral shaping filter function (e.g., Gaussian filtering) to the TX data stream. The filter is implemented as a 17-tap digital FIR filter, and thus internally there are a total of 17 filter coefficients. However, the values of the tap coefficients are symmetrical: Coeff16=Coeff0, Coeff15=Coeff1, etc. Thus it is only necessary to store a total of 9 coefficients (Coeff8 thru Coeff0); the internal circuitry obtains the remaining coefficients through symmetry.
    • This property specifies the 8th coefficient of the TX shaping filter.
    • The filtering function provided by the default suggested coefficient values is Gaussian filtering with B*T=0.5. Other filtering functions are possible; please contact Silicon Labs for filter coefficient values.
    • The spectral shaping filter function is used only in TX mode, and is not available when using TX Direct Asynchronous mode.
  • Default: 0x67
  • Register View:
    • MODEM_TX_FILTER_COEFF_8
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x0f TXCOE8
    Default
    0x67

  • Field Details:
    MODEM_TX_FILTER_COEFF_8
    TXCOE8[7:0]
    Default:
    0x67

MODEM_TX_FILTER_COEFF_7

  • Group: 0x20
  • Index: 0x10
  • Summary: The 7th coefficient of TX spectral shaping filter.
  • Purpose:
    • This property specifies the 7th coefficient of the TX shaping filter.
    • Please refer to the text description for MODEM_TX_FILTER_COEFF_8 for more details regarding TX spectral shaping filtering.
  • Default: 0x60
  • Register View:
    • MODEM_TX_FILTER_COEFF_7
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x10 TXCOE7
    Default
    0x60

MODEM_TX_RAMP_DELAY

  • Group: 0x20
  • Index: 0x18
  • Summary: TX ramp-down delay setting.
  • Purpose:
    • This property specifies the delay time between transmission of the final symbol of a 2(G)FSK or 4(G)FSK packet and the start of the ramp-down of the PA output power. This configurable delay time ensures that all symbols have been fully transmitted before any reduction in output power occurs.
    • This property applies only in TX mode, and has no effect when using OOK modulation.
    • Units of the delay are in bit/symbol periods. The WDS Calculator suggests an appropriate delay value as a function of the selected modulation type and data rate.
  • Default: 0x01
  • Register View:
    • MODEM_TX_RAMP_DELAY
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x18 0 0 0 0 0 RAMP_DLY
    Default
    0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x1

  • Field Details:
    MODEM_TX_RAMP_DELAY
    RAMP_DLY[2:0]
    Min:
    0x1
    Max:
    0x7
    Default:
    0x1

MODEM_MDM_CTRL

  • Group: 0x20
  • Index: 0x19
  • Summary: MDM control.
  • Purpose:
    • Detector selection and PM pattern configuration.
  • Default: 0x00
  • Register View:
    • MODEM_MDM_CTRL
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x19 PH_SRC_SEL 0 0 0 0 0 0 0
    Default
    0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    MODEM_MDM_CTRL
    PH_SRC_SEL
    Description:
    BCR/Slicer phase source selection.
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    ENUM_0 0 Input from phase computer output.
    ENUM_1 1 Input from detector's output.

MODEM_IF_CONTROL

  • Group: 0x20
  • Index: 0x1a
  • Summary: Selects Fixed-IF, Scaled-IF, or Zero-IF mode of RX Modem operation.
  • Purpose:
    • The chip normally operates with a fixed IF frequency of Fxtal / 64 (e.g., 30.0 MHz / 64 = 468.75 kHz). As a low-side Mixer injection scheme is used, this places the image response at 2*468.75 kHz = 937.5 kHz below the desired channel.
    • It is possible to configure the chip to operate with a lower IF frequency, given by the formula: Fif = Fxtal / (64 * N). As this value is related to the fixed IF frequency by the scale factor 'N', it is referred to as Scaled-IF mode.
    • The scale factor 'N' (and thus also the resulting scaled IF frequency) is automatically suggested by the WDS Calculator as a function of the selected data rate, with lower IF frequencies resulting for lower data rates. The scale factor 'N' is always an integer value, and is usually (but not always) a power of 2 (e.g.,N = 2^M).
    • Scaled-IF mode may be useful when it is desired to position the image response at a frequency other than that normally resulting from the Fixed-IF mode of operation.
    • It is also possible to configure the chip to operate with zero IF frequency, with the benefit that image response frequency is eliminated. However, the RX sensitivity of the chip is somewhat degraded in Zero-IF mode. Also, the RFIC currently does not support reception of an OOK modulated signal in Zero-IF mode.
    • The value of the MODEM_IF_FREQ property should set be in accordance with this property (i.e., to the appropriate value of IF frequency for Fixed-IF or Scaled-IF mode, or to a value of zero for Zero-IF mode).
    • If the ZEROIF bit is set, the FIXIF bit should be cleared.
  • Default: 0x08
  • Register View:
    • MODEM_IF_CONTROL
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x1a 0 0 0 ZEROIF FIXIF 0 ETSI_MODE
    Default
    0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x1 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    MODEM_IF_CONTROL
    ZEROIF
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    NORMAL 0 Non zero-IF mode (i.e., fixed IF or scalable IF mode).
    ZERO 1 Zero-IF mode.
    FIXIF
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    SCALED 0 Scaled-IF mode.
    FIXED 1 Fixed-IF mode.
    ETSI_MODE[1:0]
    Format:
    Enumeration
    Name Value Description Feature Available
    DISABLE 0 Disables ETSI mode.
    ETSI_868 1 Enables ETSI mode for the 868 MHz frequency band low phase noise.
    ETSI_169 2 Enables ETSI mode for the 169 MHz frequency band without SAW.

MODEM_IF_FREQ

  • Group: 0x20
  • Indexes: 0x1b ... 0x1d
  • Summary: the IF frequency setting (an 18-bit signed number).
  • Purpose:
    • In RX mode, the chip uses a low-side Mixer injection scheme (except when in Zero-IF mode). The FREQ_CONTROL_INTE and FREQ_CONTROL_FRAC properties define the channel center frequency; in order to receive on this frequency the chip automatically shifts the RX LO frequency downwards by an amount equal to the IF frequency.
    • The MODEM_IF_FREQ property defines the amount by which the RX LO frequency is shifted.
    • This value is a signed 18-bit number. It is summed with the frequency control word for the PLL Synthesizer, and thus must contain a negative value in order to provide a downwards shift in frequency.
    • In Fixed-IF and Scaled-IF mode, the IF frequency is given by the following equation:




      where N=1 for Fixed-IF mode and N=2,3,4... for Scaled-IF mode. Example: in Fixed-IF mode with the nominal crystal frequency of 30.0 MHz, the IF frequency is 30 MHz / 64 = 468.75 kHz. In Scaled-IF mode, the scale factor 'N' is always an integer value and is usually (but not always) a power of 2 (e.g., N = 2M).
    • In Zero-IF mode, the MODEM_IF_FREQ should be set = 0x00000.
    • The units of the MODEM_IF_FREQ property are in increments of the LSB tuning resolution of the PLL Synthesizer, and are therefore a function of the crystal reference frequency and output frequency band. The formula for calculating the positive representation of the MODEM_IF_FREQ property is given by the following equation:




    • The output divider value OUTDIV is configured as a function of the desired frequency band, and is specified in property MODEM_CLKGEN_BAND:BAND.
    • The prescaler divider value NPRESC is configured as a function of the selected synthesizer performance mode and may take on the values NPRESC=2 or NPRESC=4, as specified in property MODEM_CLKGEN_BAND:SY_SEL.
    • Example: for the nominal Fixed-IF mode IF frequency of 468.75kHz when operating in the 915 MHz band (OUTDIV=4) with a 30 MHz crystal, the calculated positive representation of MODEM_IF_FREQ = 16384 = 0x4000.
    • The appropriate value to program into the MODEM_IF_FREQ property is the complement of the calculated positive representation, e.g., 0x3C000.
  • Defaults: 0x03,0xc0,0x00
  • Register View:
    • MODEM_IF_FREQ
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x1b 0 0 0 0 0 0 IF_FREQ[17:16]
    0x1c IF_FREQ[15:8]
    0x1d IF_FREQ[7:0]
    Defaults
    0x1b 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x3
    0x1c 0xc0
    0x1d 0x0

  • Field Details:
    MODEM_IF_FREQ
    IF_FREQ[17:0]
    Description:
    18-bit IF frequency.
    Default:
    0x3c000

MODEM_DECIMATION_CFG1

  • Group: 0x20
  • Index: 0x1e
  • Summary: Specifies three decimator ratios for the Cascaded Integrator Comb (CIC) filter.
  • Purpose:
    • The RX channel selection bandpass filtering is provided by a digital filter within the RX Modem circuit block. The filter bandwidth is a function of the filter tap coefficients and the clock or sample rate of the filter. That is, using the same set of filter tap coefficients with different filter clock rates will result in different filter bandwidths.
    • The high-speed I/Q data samples from the RX A/D Converters are decimated by a programmable ratio in order to provide the desired sample rate at the input of the digital filter. The decimation ratio is determined by the NDEC0, NDEC1, and NDEC2 values in this property, and thus these values (in conjunction with the filter tap coefficients specified in MODEM_CHFLT_RX1_CHFLT_COEXX) determine the RX channel selection filter bandwidth.
    • The decimation ratio of each decimator circuit block is 2NDEC. In (G)FSK mode the RX data samples pass through two cascaded decimator blocks, and thus the decimation ratio is 2(NDEC1+NDEC2). In OOK mode, the post-demodulated RX data samples pass through an additional decimator block with decimation ratio 2NDEC0. If not in OOK mode, this decimation coefficient should be set NDEC0 = 0.
    • There is an additional polyphase filter and decimator circuit block, located prior to the decimators controlled by the NDEC0/1/2 coefficients. The decimation ratio of this "pre-decimator" block is controlled by bits within the MODEM_DECIMATION_CFG0 property. The total decimation ratio is the product of the ratios of the individual circuit blocks.
  • Default: 0x10
  • Register View:
    • MODEM_DECIMATION_CFG1
    Index 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    0x1e NDEC2 NDEC1 NDEC0 0
    Default
    0x0 0x1 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    MODEM_DECIMATION_CFG1
    NDEC2[1:0]
    Description:
    • Decimation coefficient for the second of two cascaded decimation circuit blocks in the CIC filter.
    • Decimating rate is 2NDEC2.
    Format:
    Enumeration
